reviews.review_msg: This was Nates first time teaching a CMPT course. The start was rough but he improved at teaching quickly throughout the semester. Sometimes still struggles to get points across but he is very enthusiastic and tries his best to help students both inside and outside of class. The assignments take up a lot of time. The tests were fair.

There is a lot of material in this class both in the lecture slides and the assignments, prepare to work hard in this class. Assignments were quite challenging, although for someone with lots of C experience the opposite could be true. Payne is a decent teacher but he often tries to cover way to much material (100 slides/class)

Nate is energetic and genuinely cares that students do well. Although not the best communicator, he still gets the key points across. Lectures are posted well ahead of time. Assignments were tough but I ended up learning a lot. Midterm was fair but the final was tougher. Solid choice of professor, hopefully he gets a permanent office next semester.
